_meanings:
{@--1@} As a prefix to verbs it
means ‘forward’, ‘forth’, ‘in
front’, ‘onward’, ‘before’, ‘away’,
as in {#pragam, prasyA, pracar, praya#} &c.

{@--2@}
With adjectives it means ‘very’,
‘excessively’, ‘very much’ &c:  
{#prakfzwa, pramatta#} &c., see further on.

{@--3@} With
nouns whether derived from verbs
or not, it is used in the following
senses according to <ls>G. M.</ls>:-- ({%a%})
beginning, commencement; ({#pramARaM#},
{#prasTAnaM, prahRa#}); ({%b%}) length; ( 
{#pravAlaBUzika#}); ({%c%}) power ({#praBu#}); ({%d%}) 
intensity, excess; ({#pravAda, prakarza, pracCAya#}, 
{#praguRa#}); ({%e%}) source or origin; ({#praBava, prapOtra#});
({%f%}) completion, perfectness, 
satisfaction ({#praBuktamannaM#}); ({%g%}) destitution,
separation, being without; ({#prozitA#},
{#praparRavfkzaH#}); ({%h%}) apart; ({#prajYu#}); ({%i%})
excellence; ({#prAcAryaH#}): ({%j%}) purity
({#prasannaM jalaM#}); ({%k%}) wish ({#prArTanA#}); ({%l%})
cessation ({#praSama#}); ({%<ab>m.</ab>%}) adoration,
respect; ({#prAMjaliH#} who respectfully
folds his hands together); ({%<ab>n.</ab>%}) 
prominence ({#praRasa, pravAla#}). In the Veda
it is often used as a separable 
adverb.
